title: Ticket #2875: Jobs with new style arguments don't show args in condor_q
description:
If a job is using new style arguments, then the arguments won't appear under "CMD" in the output of condor_q. 

% cat submit-1
executable=/bin/echo
universe=vanilla
hold=true
arguments=arguments bare 1 2 3
queue
% condor_submit submit-1
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 58.
% cat submit-2
executable=/bin/echo
universe=vanilla
hold=true
arguments="arguments quoted 1 2 3"
queue
% condor_submit submit-2
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 59.
% condor_q


-- Submitter: puffin.cs.wisc.edu : <128.105.185.14:36212> : puffin.cs.wisc.edu
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
  58.0   adesmet         3/8  17:29   0+00:00:00 H  0   97.7 echo arguments bar
  59.0   adesmet         3/8  17:29   0+00:00:00 H  0   97.7 echo

2 jobs; 0 idle, 0 running, 2 held

In the above, it is expected that the "CMD" entry for both jobs would be identical.

The code that collects the information is in /src/condor_utils/condor_arglist.cpp in ArgList::GetArgsStringForDisplay. That code's attempt to look up ATTR_JOB_ATTRIBUTE2 appears to always fail. Hypothesis: the ClassAd projection code that only sends requested attributes doesn't realize that ATTR_JOB_ATTRIBUTE2 is needed in addition to ATTR_JOB_ATTRIBUTE1.

Possible fixes:

  • Ensure that whenever ATTR_JOB_ATTRIBUTE1 is included in a projection, automatically include ATTR_JOB_ATTRIBUTE2. A bit special case. You could do this on the schedd's side (very magical and non-obvious) or on the condor_q side.
  • Change condor_submit. to ensure that ATTR_JOB_ATTRIBUTE2 ("Arguments") is always present. See #2876: Ensure Arguments is always in job ad, even if old Args is being used
